newsitem.title: USA: Harris sees double-digit growth in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Harris sees double-digit growth in 1997.

text.p: Harris Corp, reporting higher first quarter net income, said it was encouraged by its five-year string of earnings growth and said it expected double-digit earnings growth in fiscal 1997.

"Given a continuation of the overall economic and market trends, we expect to have another year of double-digit earnings growth in fiscal 1997, coupled with good revenues," said Harris' chairman, Phillip Farmer, in a statement accompanying the earnings announcement.
"The semiconductor sector is still impacted by a weak market, but Harris' other businesses are recording excellent growth," Farmer said.
Harris Corp reported net income of $38.1 million, or $0.98 per share for the first quarter ended September 30, compared with a 1995 first quarter profit of $33.5 million, or $0.86 per share.
The per-share net exceeded analysts' estimates of $0.96 per share.
